name: Marco & Polo Go Round
description:
“Marco & Polo Go Round” is a virtual-reality short that defies the laws of gravity.

On the morning of his birthday, Marco joins his girlfriend Polo in the kitchen but something strange is going on. The chairs are battened to the floor and the cupboard and fridge doors are taped shut. Polo doesn’t seem to notice. She’s just excited to present him with the cake she has just made.

Little by little, the couple’s areas of disagreement come to the surface and the joyful atmosphere soon turns to shock as various objects come loose and start to fly around them.
“Marco & Polo Go Round” plunges the viewer into a young couple’s intimate relationship and invites them to physically experience the crisis they are going through as they navigate this distorted, topsy-turvy world.

This film uses several real-time approaches and technologies such as volumetric capture to preserve the glances and movements of the actors (Léane Labrèche-Dor and Emmanuel Schwartz).

MARCO & POLO GO ROUND:
- A film with an intimate, surreal screenplay that deals with love and its fragile nature
- An innovative approach based on volumetric capture and special effects to produce an immersive experience.
- An extraordinary visual universe in which the viewer moves around as if in a living painting.
- A 14-minute sensory and narrative experience.
- Selected for the Tribeca, Cannes XR and Annecy festivals and winner of the Kaohsiung XR Dreamland Festival
